item.title: Bare blinky
item.author: hexdhog@pm.me (hexdhog)
item.description: I have messed with electronics for quite some time now, pretty much ever since I started programming. Actually, I learned basic C programming by playing in Arduino IDE. So I have a decent understanding of how to write basic programs that run on Arduino-like compatible microcontrollers; but I have a mediocre understanding of what is actually going on when I use the Arduino or, even, the own chip’s framework. So I want to go down the software stack and understand exactly what really happens under the hood. I think making an LED blink, an extremely basic task, in assembly and without any libraries/frameworks is a decent starting point.
